_metadata.title: Comprehensive BCI Hardware Specifications Inventory
_metadata.description: Exhaustive hardware specifications for known clinical and consumer BCI devices, compiled from public sources including FDA filings, manufacturer datasheets, peer-reviewed papers, and patents.
notes: Confidence levels: HIGH = manufacturer spec sheet or FDA filing; MEDIUM = peer-reviewed paper or credible technical analysis; LOW = inferred, estimated, or single secondary source.
null values indicate data not publicly available or not found.

All thermal safety context: FDA/IEEE limit is 1 degree C max tissue temperature rise; IEEE C95.1-2019 SAR limit 1.6 W/kg (10g averaged, 6 min); BCI power budgets typically capped at 15-40 mW depending on implant depth.

devices.fda_status: De novo classification granted Jan 2025; IDE clinical trial (PRIME) ongoing

channel_count.notes: 32 electrodes per thread x 64 threads. ASIC supports 3072 channels (12 x 256-ch chips) but current implant uses 1024.

power_consumption_total.notes: Approximately 6 mW total ASIC power including clock drivers.

die_chip_size.source: Technical analyses of Neuralink white paper

process_node.notes: CMOS process. Likely TSMC but foundry not confirmed.

implant_dimensions.notes: Circular coin-shaped device implanted flush with skull.

battery_life.notes: Wirelessly rechargeable via inductive charger. Exact battery capacity not disclosed.

core_specs.charging_method: Wireless inductive charging (custom compact charger with NFC)

thermal_dissipation.value: < 40 mW system budget (FDA guideline for cortical implants)
thermal_dissipation.notes: Thermal sensors monitor temperature during charging; auto-adjusts power transfer.
thermal_dissipation.source: FDA BCI guidance 2021; Neuralink press materials

wireless_protocol.notes: Custom BLE implementation for data streaming.

data_rate.notes: 1024 channels x 20 kHz x 10 bits = ~200 Mbps raw. On-chip compression reduces transmitted data.

electrode_material.value: Gold traces on polyimide threads; electrode tips treated with iridium oxide (IrOx) or PEDOT:PSS

signal_to_noise_ratio.notes: Not explicitly published. 0.83 dB SNR loss at 100 kOhm impedance with 1 MOhm input impedance reported.

sampling_rate.notes: On-chip ADC at 19.3 kSPS per channel, 10-bit resolution.

channel_count.notes: Expected to increase beyond 1024. Neuralink working on more electrodes and longer battery life. Blind insertion through dura planned.

power_consumption_total.notes: Not disclosed. Improvements over N1 expected.

implant_dimensions.notes: Similar form factor to N1 expected. Mass production planned for 2026.

core_specs.directionality: read-only initially; bidirectional (stimulation) planned for vision restoration
core_specs.implant_location: cortical (motor cortex and visual cortex planned)

physics_constraints.notes: Specifications not yet publicly available. R1 surgical robot improvements: 1.5 second thread insertion, blind dura penetration, obstacle avoidance.

devices.fda_status: 510(k) cleared (K110010); IDE for various BCI trials

channel_count.value: 96-128 per array; up to 1024 with multiple arrays
channel_count.notes: Standard configuration is 96 electrodes (10x10 grid minus corners). NeuroPort-96 is the FDA-cleared human version.
channel_count.source: Blackrock Neurotech product page; FDA 510(k) K110010

power_consumption_total.notes: The Utah Array itself is passive (no active electronics on the array). Power is consumed by the external NeuroPort data acquisition system.

die_chip_size.source: Blackrock product page; NIH BRAIN Initiative device info

electrode_length.notes: Penetrating electrodes that insert into cortex gray matter.

implant_dimensions.value: 4 x 4 mm array + percutaneous pedestal connector
implant_dimensions.notes: Pedestal is skull-mounted; external wired connection to NeuroPort system.

weight.notes: Array itself is very light (<1g); pedestal adds weight.

core_specs.directionality: bidirectional (recording and stimulation with SIROF electrodes)

operating_frequency_neural.notes: Analog front-end bandwidth of NeuroPort system.

wireless_protocol.notes: External NeuroPort system connects via cable. Wireless versions (BrainGate) use custom 48 Mbps wireless transmitter.

data_rate.value: 48 Mbps (wireless BrainGate variant); wired system supports 30 kSPS x 96 ch
data_rate.source: BrainGate wireless BCI publication (Nature Biomedical Engineering)

electrode_material.value: Silicon shank with platinum or iridium oxide (IrOx) tips; SIROF (sputtered iridium oxide film) variant for stimulation

electrode_impedance.notes: Typical range at 1 kHz. High impedance electrodes for single-unit recording.

signal_to_noise_ratio.notes: Described as 'superior SNR' by manufacturer. Typical values in literature: 5-15 dB for single units.

sampling_rate.notes: NeuroPort system: 30 kSPS per channel, 16-bit resolution, 250 nV resolution. Configurable: 2/10/30 kSPS.
sampling_rate.source: NeuroPort system manual; Scitech distributor spec sheet

proven_longevity.notes: Demonstrated chronic recording and stimulation for over 8 years in a single patient.

devices.manufacturer: BrainGate Consortium (originally Cyberkinetics; arrays by Blackrock Neurotech)

channel_count.notes: Uses Blackrock Utah Arrays. Original: single 96-ch array. Recent: two arrays (192-200 ch) with wireless transmitters.

implant_dimensions.notes: Same as Utah Array. Wireless variant adds small transmitter modules.

battery_life.notes: Two wireless devices recorded at 48 Mbps from 200 electrodes with >36 hour battery life.

wireless_protocol.value: Custom 48 Mbps wireless (for wireless variant); wired pedestal (original)

channel_count.notes: Senses from up to 4 channels. Each lead has 4 electrode contacts. Two leads supported (8 contacts total, mapped to 4 amp channels).
channel_count.source: NeuroPace RNS System manual; FDA PMA P100026

implant_dimensions.notes: Neurostimulator body. Implanted in cranial bone (craniectomy pocket).
implant_dimensions.source: NIH BRAIN Initiative device info sheet

battery_life.notes: Next-gen: 8 years. Original model: up to 10.8 years at medium settings. Non-rechargeable.

core_specs.charging_method: Non-rechargeable (primary cell); device replacement at end-of-life
core_specs.implant_location: cranial (neurostimulator in skull bone); leads at seizure foci (cortical or depth)

operating_frequency_neural.notes: Records electrocorticographic (ECoG) patterns. Specific filter range not publicly detailed.

wireless_protocol.notes: Uses a programming wand held near the device for data download and programming. Not continuous wireless streaming.

electrode_material.notes: 4 contacts per lead, configurable as anode/cathode. Case can serve as cathode.

electrode_impedance.notes: Impedance stabilizes after ~1 year. Constant-current design compensates for impedance changes.

sampling_rate.notes: Internal sampling rate not publicly detailed in available sources.

stimulation_parameters.notes: Responsive stimulation triggered by detected abnormal ECoG patterns.

devices.target_indication: Parkinson's disease, essential tremor, dystonia, epilepsy, OCD

channel_count.notes: Supports 1-2 DBS leads. BrainSense technology enables simultaneous sensing and stimulation.
channel_count.source: Medtronic product page; Expert Rev Med Devices 2021

implant_dimensions.notes: 20% smaller and thinner than predecessor Activa PC.

volume.source: Device profile publication (Expert Rev Med Devices 2021)

battery_life.notes: Silver vanadium oxide primary cell. BrainSense sensing shortens battery life. Percept RC variant: rechargeable, 15+ year service life.

core_specs.charging_method: Non-rechargeable (Percept PC); Wireless inductive recharging (Percept RC)
core_specs.implant_location: subcutaneous chest pocket (IPG); leads in subthalamic nucleus, globus pallidus, or thalamus

operating_frequency_neural.notes: BrainSense records local field potentials, not single units.

devices.target_indication: Same as Percept PC (Parkinson's, tremor, dystonia, epilepsy, OCD)

battery_life.notes: Rechargeable variant with consistent fast recharge.

core_specs.implant_location: subcutaneous chest pocket; DBS leads in brain

channel_count.notes: 16-electrode sensing array on self-expanding nitinol stent.
channel_count.source: Synchron technology page; JAMA Neurology publication (PMC9857731)

power_consumption_total.notes: Total power budget constrained to less than 10 mW. Power gating reduces idle consumption.
power_consumption_total.source: Auctores technical review of Stentrode system

implant_dimensions.value: Stent diameter matches vessel: 4-7 mm at superior sagittal sinus
implant_dimensions.notes: Stent-electrode array deployed endovascularly. BrainPort receiver implanted in chest.

battery_life.notes: Wireless power via near-field RF to chest-mounted BrainPort unit. Avoids invasive battery replacements.

core_specs.charging_method: Wireless near-field RF inductive power (~30 mm depth, ~2% efficiency)
core_specs.implant_location: endovascular (superior sagittal sinus, adjacent to motor cortex); BrainPort receiver in chest

operating_frequency_neural.notes: Low-noise amplifier optimized for this range.

wireless_protocol.notes: BrainPort chest unit transmits via BLE to external devices. Practical limit ~1 Mbps.
wireless_protocol.source: Auctores technical review; Being Patient article

data_rate.notes: BLE practical upper limit in implantable configuration.

electrode_material.value: Platinum electrodes on nitinol (nickel-titanium) self-expanding stent

electrode_impedance.notes: Mean impedance 37 +/- 11 kOhm between recording and reference electrodes.

input_noise.notes: Input-referred noise floor of low-noise amplifier.

sampling_rate.notes: Not publicly specified. Power gating can reduce sampling rates during idle.

devices.device_name: Nucleus Profile Plus (CI632) with Contour Advance Electrode
devices.target_indication: Severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss

channel_count.notes: 22 half-banded platinum electrodes. Most active sequential contacts in the cochlear implant industry.
channel_count.source: Cochlear product page; cochlearimplanthelp.com spec sheet

power_consumption_total.notes: Internal receiver/stimulator has no battery; derives all power from external sound processor via RF link.

implant_dimensions.notes: Profile Plus is the thinnest Cochlear implant. Specific dimensions not found in public sources.

battery_life.value: N/A (externally powered via RF from sound processor)
battery_life.notes: Sound processor battery: rechargeable, ~16-30 hours per charge depending on processor model.

core_specs.implant_location: temporal bone (receiver/stimulator); electrode array in cochlea

stimulation_rate.notes: Depends on processing strategy. ACE strategy: up to 2500 Hz. Max rates 1245-4800 pps depending on configuration.

wireless_protocol.notes: Coil-to-coil between external processor and internal receiver.

electrode_spacing.notes: Non-uniform spacing over 14.25 mm active electrode length.

channel_count.notes: 12 channels with 24 current sources (12 pairs). 19 physical active platinum electrode contacts.

electrode_array_lengths.notes: FLEX series: FLEX 20 (20mm), FLEX 24, FLEX 26, FLEX28, FLEXSOFT (31.5mm), FLEX 34 (34mm). Longest arrays in the industry for complete cochlear coverage.

core_specs.implant_location: temporal bone; electrode array in cochlea

electrode_material.value: Platinum contacts with wave-shaped wires on lateral-wall design

channel_count.notes: Standard leads: 8 contacts. Cartesia X / Cartesia HX directional leads: 16 contacts (first and only FDA-approved 16-contact DBS lead).

battery_life.notes: Zero Volt battery technology prevents failure even if completely discharged. Rechargeable: 30 days between recharge cycles.

core_specs.implant_location: subcutaneous chest pocket (IPG); leads in subthalamic nucleus, GPi, or VIM thalamus

devices.device_name: St. Jude Medical Infinity DBS System

channel_count.notes: 8-contact directional lead (1.27 mm diameter). Two center electrodes segmented into 3 segments each for directional stimulation. Supports single-lead (Infinity 5) or bilateral (Infinity 7).

implant_dimensions.notes: Infinity 5 IPG: 30.4 cm3 volume. Infinity 7 IPG: 38.6 cm3 volume. Smallest non-rechargeable DBS device on market. Lead diameter: 1.27 mm.

weight.notes: 25% smaller than competition at time of launch. Exact weight not found in public sources.

core_specs.implant_location: subcutaneous pocket (IPG); leads in brain targets

channel_count.notes: Plus CMS/DRL references at P3/P4. Positions: AF3, F7, F3, FC5, T7, P7, O1, O2, P8, T8, FC6, F4, F8, AF4.

weight.notes: Lightweight wireless headset. Exact weight not found.

operating_frequency_neural.notes: Bandwidth with digital notch filters at 50 Hz and 60 Hz.

wireless_protocol.value: Proprietary 2.4 GHz wireless (USB dongle) + Bluetooth Low Energy

sampling_rate.notes: Internal ADC runs at 2048 Hz; downsampled to 128 or 256 SPS output.

adc_resolution.notes: 1 LSB = 0.51 uV at 14-bit. 2 bits discarded as instrumental noise floor. Can be set to 16-bit mode.

channel_count.notes: Positions: AF3, AF4, T7, T8, Pz. Plus CMS/DRL references on left mastoid.

devices.target_indication: Open-source EEG/EMG/ECG research and BCI development

channel_count.notes: Expandable to 16 channels with Daisy module (at 125 SPS). High gain, low noise inputs.

power_consumption_total.notes: Operating voltage: 3.3V digital, +/-2.5V analog. Input voltage 3.3-12V.

implant_dimensions.notes: Open-source PCB; pairs with various electrode caps.

battery_life.notes: Powered by external battery or USB. Not integrated battery.

sampling_rate.notes: 250 SPS for 8 channels. 125 SPS with 16-channel Daisy configuration.

adc_resolution.notes: Texas Instruments ADS1299 ADC. Ganglion transmits 18-bit (compressed from 24-bit).

input_noise.notes: Measured with inputs shorted to internal GND.

wireless_protocol.value: RFDuino (custom Bluetooth via USB dongle); WiFi shield available

electrode_material.value: Compatible with passive and active electrodes (gold cup, Ag/AgCl, dry, etc.)

adc_resolution.notes: Compresses 24-bit to 18-bit for BLE transmission. Worst case resolution loss: ~0.12 uV.

channel_count.notes: Electrode positions: TP9, AF7, AF8, TP10. Reference at FPz (CMS/DRL).

electrode_material.value: Dry conductive rubber (forehead) and conductive silicone (behind ear)

channel_count.notes: Same EEG positions as Muse 2 (TP9, AF7, AF8, TP10) plus 2 amplified aux channels.

devices.target_indication: Speech restoration for ALS and locked-in syndrome

channel_count.notes: Up to 4 high-density ECoG grids totaling 128 channels. Grid: 8x16 electrodes, 2 mm diameter, 5 mm spacing.

core_specs.implant_location: cortical surface (subdural ECoG over speech and hand motor areas)

operating_frequency_neural.notes: Decodes broadband high-gamma cortical representations for speech and upper limb movements.

data_acquisition.value: Blackrock Microsystems NeuroPort Neural Signal Processor (external)

devices.target_indication: Speech restoration for ALS and paralysis

channel_count.value: 421 per module; up to 1681 with 4 modules
channel_count.notes: Each implant smaller than a dime with 421 microelectrodes. Up to 4 implants linked for 1681 channels total.

implant_dimensions.value: 7.5 mm wide electrode array; <19 mm module diameter (smaller than a dime)
implant_dimensions.notes: Electrode array inserted 1.5 mm into brain. Individual electrodes <40 microns (thinner than a hair).

battery_life.notes: Powered via inductive charging (like smartphone wireless charging). Second transceiver provides power.

core_specs.charging_method: Wireless inductive power coupling + near-infrared optical data link

data_rate.notes: Pre-clinical: >200 bits per second ITR with 56 ms system latency. Raw neural data rate would be much higher.
data_rate.source: Paradromics product page; IEEE Pulse article

wireless_protocol.value: Near-infrared optical data link (secure) + inductive power coupling
wireless_protocol.notes: Patented optical data link rather than RF.
wireless_protocol.source: Paradromics product page; Parola Analytics patent analysis

electrode_material.notes: Material not publicly specified. Likely platinum or platinum-iridium.

devices.target_indication: Intraoperative cortical mapping; future: chronic BCI

channel_count.notes: Modular design: multiple arrays can be tiled for 2000+ channels. 600x greater electrode density than standard cortical arrays.
channel_count.source: Precision Neuroscience product page; bioRxiv preprint 2022.01.02.474656

implant_dimensions.value: ~postage stamp sized array; 5 um thick polyimide substrate
implant_dimensions.notes: 1/5th the thickness of a human hair. Inserted subdurally through <1 mm incision.
implant_dimensions.source: Precision Neuroscience product page; Auctores review

sampling_rate.source: Auctores review; Precision Neuroscience product page

electrode_material.value: Platinum electrodes on 5 um polyimide substrate

electrode_diameter.notes: Range of electrode diameters across array.

wireless_protocol.value: Currently wired (external); wireless planned for future chronic version

devices.fda_status: Research program (not a specific device for clinical use)
devices.target_indication: Military: able-bodied warfighter neural control of systems

channel_count.notes: Target: read from and write to 16 independent channels within a 16 mm3 volume within 50 ms.

spatial_resolution.notes: Target neural ensemble resolution for noninvasive interfaces.

approaches.method: Acousto-optical recording + interfering electrical fields for stimulation
approaches.notes: Ultrasound waves guide light into/out of brain to detect neural activity.

approaches.method: Coherent optical system measuring optical path-length changes

approaches.notes: Advanced to Phase II. Uses nanotransducers delivered nonsurgically.

approaches.method: Micro optically pumped magnetometers + focused ultrasound
approaches.notes: Magnetometers detect neural magnetic fields; ultrasound writes to neurons.

physics_constraints.notes: N3 is a program with multiple approaches, not a single device. Performance targets are aspirational.

electrode_material.value: Hybrid conductive material (supports dry or gel recording)

devices.fda_status: Research device (not FDA cleared for clinical use)
devices.target_indication: Functional neuroimaging research; brain health assessment

channel_count.notes: 52 modules, each with 1 dual-wavelength laser source + 6 detectors = 312 source-detector pairs minimum. Cross-module channels add more.

operating_wavelengths.notes: Dual wavelength time-domain fNIRS. Laser pulses <150 ps wide.

source_detector_separation.notes: Within-module SDS. Cross-module channels also available.

module_count.notes: Arranged in 4 plates per hemisphere covering frontal, parietal, temporal, and occipital cortices.

wireless_protocol.notes: Wired (tethered to processing unit). Wearable but not wireless.

fda_max_tissue_temp_rise.notes: Maximum allowable temperature increase in brain tissue before cellular damage risk. Most stringent FDA guideline.
fda_max_tissue_temp_rise.source: FDA BCI guidance (2021); NCBI Bookshelf NBK3932

typical_bci_power_budget.notes: Exact limit varies by implant depth. Single-chip cortical config: max ~2.92 mW before 1 C rise. Eight-chip config: ~1.25 mW per chip.
typical_bci_power_budget.source: Ann Biomed Eng 2024 (Springer); NCBI Bookshelf NBK3932

source_bibliography.citation: Musk E, Neuralink. An integrated brain-machine interface platform with thousands of channels. J Med Internet Res. 2019;21(10):e16194.
Blackrock Microsystems. NeuroPort Cortical Microelectrode Array System. FDA 510(k) K110010.
NeuroPace RNS System. FDA PMA P100026.
Mitchell P, et al. Assessment of Safety of a Fully Implanted Endovascular Brain-Computer Interface for Severe Paralysis in 4 Patients. JAMA Neurol. 2023.
Gilron R, et al. Device profile of the Percept PC deep brain stimulation system. Expert Rev Med Devices. 2021;18(4):319-332.
Ban HY, et al. Kernel Flow: a high channel count scalable time-domain functional near-infrared spectroscopy system. J Biomed Opt. 2022;27(7):074710.
Insanally M, et al. The Layer 7 Cortical Interface: A Scalable and Minimally Invasive Brain-Computer Interface Platform. bioRxiv. 2022.
Kim S, et al. Thermal Considerations for the Design of an Implanted Cortical Brain-Machine Interface. In: Indwelling Neural Implants. NCBI Bookshelf NBK3932.
FDA. Implanted Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) Devices for Patients with Paralysis or Amputation. 2021.
EMOTIV. EPOC X User Manual - Technical Specifications.
Blackrock Neurotech. NeuroPort Biopotential Signal Processing System IFU. LB-0323 Rev 8.00.
Krauss JK, et al. Update on Current Technologies for Deep Brain Stimulation. PMC7502302.
Cochlear Ltd. Technical Specifications Cochlear Nucleus Profile Plus CI632.
Zierhofer C, et al. MED-EL Cochlear Implants: State of the Art and a Glimpse Into the Future. PMC4111377.
The Stentrode System by Synchron: Architectural Design and Clinical Translation. Auctores Online.
